intro: Ehrharta distichophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf grass, is a perennial grass species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the Poaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
